title: Shares of several energy companies are trading lower as oil prices dip. Concerns of a second wave of the coronavirus have caused economic uncertainty and clouded demand outlook, while a recent build in US crude inventories has led to continued oversupply concerns.

Shares of several energy companies are trading lower as equities sell off following the recent rally. Stocks have rallied over the past week amid optimism towards the US economy reopening and investors have potentially taken some profits following the run up.
